macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Edge Higher Ahead of Fed Minutes – S&P 500 Up 0.1%
items.summary: US equity markets closed marginally higher with the S&P 500 gaining 0.10% to 6,843, the Dow Jones rising 0.07% to 49,533, and the Nasdaq advancing 0.14% to 22,578, supported by a rebound in technology stocks. Treasury yields rose with the 2-year at 3.432% and 10-year at 4.058%.

items.title: Commodity Markets Weaken on US-Iran Talks Progress
items.summary: Brent crude declined 1.85% to $67.38 per barrel and WTI fell 0.95% to $62.29 following reports of constructive US-Iran negotiations. Gold dropped 2.28% to $4,877.89 as safe-haven demand eased.

items.title: AI Tool Launch Triggers Market Volatility in Wealth Management Sector
items.summary: The launch of a new AI tool claiming to automate wealth management work sent shockwaves through markets, causing several UK investment platforms to trade significantly lower with some names falling double digits. The development highlights broader market concerns about AI's impact on professional services.

items.title: Market Splits AI Trade Into Infrastructure vs. Application Layer
items.summary: Software stocks faced renewed selling pressure while mega-cap AI infrastructure companies held firm, reflecting a market repricing of AI assumptions. The divergence suggests investors are differentiating between AI infrastructure providers and application-layer companies needing to prove profitability.

items.title: RBNZ Interest Rate Decision and Australian Wage Data Expected
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand is expected to keep rates on hold at 2.25%, while Australian Wage Price Index data (expected +0.8% q/q) is due to be released, with central bank developments expected to drive volatility across sessions.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Machine Learning Extends to Complex Data Structures with Spectral Convolution on Orbifolds
items.summary: Scientists have developed spectral convolution techniques for orbifolds, enabling geometric deep learning on non-Euclidean data with symmetries, such as networks and manifolds. This breakthrough promises applications in music analysis, materials science, and computer graphics.

items.title: Clario Achieves ISO 42001 Certification for Responsible AI in Clinical Trials
items.summary: Clario announced its AI management system received ISO 42001:2023 certification after a Schellman audit, highlighting leadership in secure, ethical AI for processing millions of clinical trial data points. The company has deployed over 120 AI models more than 1,600 times to enhance data quality and patient outcomes.

items.title: University of Missouri Releases Free Tool to Verify AI Protein Structure Predictions
items.summary: Researchers at the University of Missouri developed open-source software to check the accuracy of AI-generated protein structure predictions, improving trustworthiness in scientific applications.

items.title: NOAA and MBARI Advance Deployable AI for Autonomous Deep-Sea Animal Tracking
items.summary: A new AI system for underwater vehicles enables real-time detection, following, and identification of deep-sea animals with minimal human input, tested successfully in Monterey Bay on MBARI's MiniROV.

items.title: Columbia AI Administrator Voices Skepticism on AI Hype in Higher Education
items.summary: Vice Dean Matthew Connelly at Columbia University expresses doubts about overhyped AI claims, data privacy issues in university-tech partnerships, and advocates prioritizing human intelligence over corporate AI agendas.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 Confirmed for Game Pass on March 3rd
items.summary: Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 will arrive on Xbox Game Pass on March 3rd, 2026, as part of the February wave 2 announcement. The game will be available through Play Anywhere for both Xbox and PC.

items.title: PS6 Potentially Delayed Due to RAM Crisis
items.summary: Reports suggest that a RAM crisis could impact the PlayStation 6's release timeline, raising concerns about hardware availability for the next-generation console.

items.title: eSports Market Projected to Reach $55.41 Billion by 2035
items.summary: The global eSports market is experiencing significant growth driven by mobile gaming expansion, increasing live-stream audiences, and rising brand investment across major publishers and esports organizations.

items.title: King of Tokyo Board Game Launches as Video Game
items.summary: The popular board game King of Tokyo is making its debut as a video game, allowing players to experience the beloved strategy game on digital platforms.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
